definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: The children are learning how to count.
Father always tells me to count to ten when i get angry.
sentences.chinese: 当我生气时，父亲总让我数数到十。

sentences.english: He unwrapped his pack and the first thing he did was to count his matches.
sentences.chinese: 他打开包袱，第一件事就是数数他的火柴。

sentences.english: The referee started counting over the fallen boxer.
sentences.chinese: 裁判员对着倒在地上的拳击手开始数数。

sentences.english: I asked the little boy, "Shall we count that money one more time?"
sentences.chinese: 我对小男孩，“咱们再来数数钱好吗？”
那就意味着它们能数数。

sentences.english: Most of us first learn to count and add on our fingers.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始学习数数和计算时，我们用手指帮助计算。

sentences.english: Wolves can count till 7 and foresee the results of their actions.
sentences.chinese: 野狼可以数数到7，并会预判行为的后果。

sentences.english: The little girl could only remember her numbers by counting out.
sentences.chinese: 这个小姑娘只有大声数数，才能记得住数字。

sentences.english: Another way we could estimate innovation is by counting Nobel Laureates.
sentences.chinese: 我们还可以通过数数诺贝尔奖得主比较一下创新能力。

sentences.english: However, they nearly all counted in the same way-in tens.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们几乎都用相同的方式数数，都是十进制。

sentences.english: My own research can convinience it that they have this ability from birth.
sentences.chinese: 我们自己的研究证明他们从出生就会数数了。

sentences.english: It also meant that he counted obsessively when he walked.
sentences.chinese: 这还意味着他会一边走路一边发狂地数数。

sentences.english: Dorothy, please. We're trying to count.
sentences.chinese: 桃乐丝，求你了，我们正在数数。

sentences.english: Steal several variety asset to knock several bottoms, return to yourself to calculate a number.
sentences.chinese: 偷几样东西就打几下，回去你自己数数。

sentences.english: Wang Mei opens and closes the diamond as she counts.
sentences.chinese: 王梅一边数数，一边开合“宝石建议。”

definition: to count out (a sum of money etc)
to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
number off! (command in military drill)/count off!
four rules of arithmetic/addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
to count numbers/to keep to one's word/to hold (i.e. to remain valid)/to count (i.e. to be important)
to do a sum in writing/written calculation
to take a look at/to examine/to survey/(coll.) pretty soon
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
to break off or break open sth with one's hands/(fig.) to break off (a relationship)
